results.title: Somazone (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Tom Olsson, Cinemedia, Human Services, Quit, Legal Aid Commission of Victoria, National Asthma Campaign, Electric Alchemy and Richard Jones
results.brief_description: SomaZone is about exploring, experimenting and making choices. It’s a “Life-Simulator” which gives teenagers a chance for real decision-making. By creating a “personal body”, users can take risks and see what happens. SomaZone is a multimedia package designed to look at health, society and the law from the perspective of adolescents. Discussion notes are included in the CD in WORD format. Technical requirements: Will run on PC and MAC. PC’s need Windows 3.1 or later; 486 - 66 CPU; 6MB of free RAM; 2 x CD-ROM drive; SVGA (256 colours); 16 bit Soundblaster or compatible; Quicktime for Windows 2.1.2 (supplied). Macintosh: System 7 or later; 030 - 30MHz; 6 MB of free Ram; 2 x CD-ROM drive; 256 colours; Quicktime 2.5 supplied.

results.title: Solving work problems (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Peter Quarry introduces a hree step process for discussing poor work performance with staff. Discusses real life examples of common mistakes together with the correct way to counsel staff.

results.title: Solving the problem (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The final step in the process of performance appraisal is reaching a solution relevant to the problem and its cause which involves considering realistic options, agreeing on a clear action plan and setting a review date to ensure the plan is working.

results.title: Solving linear equations with one variable
results.creator_credit: Bill Hanlon, Mark M Williams and KLVX (Television station : Las Vegas, Nev.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Algebra, you can do it”.
This program introduces solving linear equations with one variable when the variable is a natural number. Students will be shown basic rules that will allow them to solve this type of equation. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A guide accompanies this video.

results.title: Solutions: ionic and molecular. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
Illustrates the chemical nature of a solution, what happens when it forms and the role of the electrostatic forces. Shows Brownian movement, defines saturation and presents the concept of molarity along with an explanation of why some substances, eg oil, won’t dissolve in other substances such as water. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Solutions to pollution
results.brief_description: An introduction to some possible solutions to air, water, and noise pollution. Stresses conservation of resources, particularly at community level. Could be used to stimulate further in-depth discussion on some of the answers it provides. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Solutions to images
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Developing image”.
This program contains a technical survey of the main photographic processes from the daguerreotype to the Kodak#1. Explores an antique tintype gallery and shows a wet-collodion negative made during the American Civil War.
